Hyacinth
It is made, like rubies, with gold; but without such intense heat. Rubies need to be heated for a whole day, and if it does not have heat for long enough, you will obtain only reddened varnish.
left-top Always heat up your crucibles.
left-top It is believed that rubified antimony makes hyacinth.

Topaz
I melted one part of calcinated and pulverized pumice stone with three parts of minium, the stone pulverized in a steel mortar. I obtained a very nice yellow, without any one grain more yellow than the other. It is true that it was quite colorful. I think it would be better to pulverize the pumice in a glass mortar, since it and minium are yellow enough by themselves. Varnish
The Germans boil the minium intensely in linseed oil, and to give it the consistency of varnish, they mix in heavily pulverized yellow amber.

Ammoniacum
Mix it in small lumps in a little quantity of good vinegar, and heat that up. Then strain it with a cloth strainer. All medicinal gums dissolve in vinegar.
